meanings.definition: To keep watch over; to observe or guard from above.
meanings.sent1: The bird overwatches the field for any movement.
meanings.sent2: She overwatches the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent3: The drone overwatches the backyard, making sure no squirrels cause trouble.
meanings.sent4: The moon overwatches the Earth with its gentle glow.
meanings.sent5: The security camera overwatches the entrance, ensuring safety for all.

meanings.definition: The act of watching over or guarding something.
meanings.sent1: His overwatches of the neighborhood kept everyone safe.
meanings.sent2: The overwatches of the castle were diligent and alert.
meanings.sent3: The overwatches of the museum were so bored they started counting visitors.
meanings.sent4: The overwatches of the forest whispered secrets to the trees.
meanings.sent5: The overwatches of the ship scanned the horizon for any signs of danger.

meanings.definition: A group of people who keep watch over something.
meanings.sent1: The overwatches of the bank ensured no one entered after hours.
meanings.sent2: The overwatches of the event were ready to handle any situation.
meanings.sent3: The overwatches of the school had a secret snack stash in the security room.
meanings.sent4: The overwatches of the city were like silent protectors in the night.
meanings.sent5: The overwatches of the border worked tirelessly to prevent illegal crossings.
